alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 10:58PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Dale, southern Henry and northeastern Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, western Dougherty, southeastern Clay, southern Randolph, northwestern Baker, Calhoun, Early and southern Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 1130 PM EDT/1030 PM CDT/... At 1058 PM EDT/958 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Shellman to near Arlington to near Columbia to near Dothan. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morgan, Blakely, Cuthbert, Headland, Dothan, Midland City, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Edison, Newton, Arlington, Webb, Shellman, Columbia, Pinckard, Leary, Douglasville, Centerville and Grimes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
